intro: Ceramocarpium lanatum, commonly known as the hairy ceramocarpium, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its fruits are dry, indehiscent capsules that contain the seeds. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments in temperate regions.
